item.title: Docker tutorial
item.description: Getting Started The command you just ran Congratulations! You have started the container for this tutorial! Let’s first explain the command that you just ran. In case you forgot, here’s the command: docker run -d -p 80:80 docker/getting-started You’ll notice a few flags being used. Here’s some more info on them: -d - run the container in detached mode (in the background) -p 80:80 - map port 80 of the host to port 80 in the container docker/getting-started - the image to use You can combine single character flags to shorten the full command.
